intro: Corniola anxanthica, commonly known as the pale corniola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Corniola anxanthica is considered a rare and endangered species.
